metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Django Insert Data
Add Records
The Members table created in the previous chapter is empty.
content.html: The Members table created in the previous chapter is empty.

content.text: We will use the Python interpreter (Python shell) to add some members to it.
content.html: We will use the Python interpreter (Python shell) to add some members to it.

content.text: To open a Python shell, type this command:
content.html: To open a Python shell, type this command:

content.code_html: python manage.py shell

content.text: Now we are in the shell, the result should be something like this:
content.html: Now we are in the shell, the result should be something like this:

content.code:
Python 3.13.2 (tags/v3.13.2:4f8bb39, Feb  4 2025, 15:23:48) [MSC v.1942 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32

Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

(InteractiveConsole)

>>>
content.code_html:
Python 3.13.2 (tags/v3.13.2:4f8bb39, Feb 4 2025, 15:23:48) [MSC v.1942 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
(InteractiveConsole)
>>>

content.text: At the bottom, after the three >>> write the following:
content.html: At the bottom, after the three >>> write the following:

content.code_html: >>> from members.models import Member

content.text: Hit [enter] and write this to look at the empty Member table:
content.html: Hit [enter] and write this to look at the empty Member table:

content.text: This should give you an empty QuerySet object, like this:
content.html: This should give you an empty QuerySet object, like this:

content.text: A QuerySet is a collection of data from a database.
content.html: A QuerySet is a collection of data from a database.

content.text: Read more about QuerySets in the Django QuerySet chapter.
content.html: Read more about QuerySets in the Django QuerySet chapter.

content.text: Add a record to the table, by executing these two lines:
content.html: Add a record to the table, by executing these two lines:

content.code_html:
>>> member = Member(firstname='Emil', lastname='Refsnes')
>>> member.save()

content.text: Execute this command to see if the Member table got a member:
content.html: Execute this command to see if the Member table got a member:

content.text: Hopefully, the result will look like this:
content.html: Hopefully, the result will look like this:

content.text: Add Multiple Records
You can add multiple records by making a list of Member objects, and execute .save() on each entry:
content.html: You can add multiple records by making a list of Member objects, and execute .save() on each entry:

content.code:
>>> member1 = Member(firstname='Tobias', lastname='Refsnes')

>>> member2 = Member(firstname='Linus', lastname='Refsnes')

>>> member3 = Member(firstname='Lene', lastname='Refsnes')

>>> member4 = Member(firstname='Stale', lastname='Refsnes')

>>> member5 = Member(firstname='Jane', lastname='Doe')

>>> members_list = [member1, member2, member3, member4, member5]

>>> for x in members_list:

...    x.save()

...

>>>
content.code_html:
>>> member1 = Member(firstname='Tobias', lastname='Refsnes')
>>> member2 = Member(firstname='Linus', lastname='Refsnes')
>>> member3 = Member(firstname='Lene', lastname='Refsnes')
>>> member4 = Member(firstname='Stale', lastname='Refsnes')
>>> member5 = Member(firstname='Jane', lastname='Doe')
>>> members_list = [member1, member2, member3, member4, member5]
>>> for x in members_list:
...   x.save()
...
>>>

content.text: Hit [enter] one more time at the end to exit the for loop.
content.html: Hit [enter] one more time at the end to exit the for loop.

content.text: Now, if you run this command:
you will see that there are 6 members in the Member table:
content.html: you will see that there are 6 members in the Member table:

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is a correct syntax for inserting data in the Member table?
content.html: What is a correct syntax for inserting data in the Member table?
